turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Val, we're going to have to forget about the truck...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah, Heather, we got you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm dead.  Let's finish in the morning.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: We have to go into Bixby in the morning.  The concrete blocks are in.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: The con...!  Oh my God.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Just keep looking at that beautiful sky.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: That's the sky that's going to be over our roof every night, when we're done.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Ah, but consider this, if we don't finish the roof, we can looks at that sky all the time.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Well, what's wrong with it?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's...gone...!

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: You sure this is where it was?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Am I sure?!  It was right there.  There's the cord.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Come on.  Get away from it!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: God, what a stink!

turns.speaker: PHAM VAN
turns.text: Hey Val, listen.  Bearing going out, you think?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: PHAM VAN
turns.text: And I appreciate it.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: You don't get it, Pham.  The idea was: we were ripping you off.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I don't believe this.  The phone is out!  Pham, your phone is out!

turns.speaker: PHAM VAN
turns.text: I didn't do it!  What's going on?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Twenty.

turns.speaker: PHAM VAN
turns.text: Okay, ten dollars.

turns.speaker: PHAM VAN
turns.text: I've got a plan.  You and Val take your truck, get to the mountains. Hike to Bixby.  Get us some help.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Those scumsuckers are my radials, Pham!

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Hi, I'm Rhonda.  Rhonda LeBeck. I'm up here for the semester...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah, geography.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Right, geology.  And you have to be Val and Earl.  I've heard all about you.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Listen, got a question for you.  Do you know if anybody is doing any blasting or drilling or anything like that?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Around here?  Why would they?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Well, I'm supposed monitor these seismographs.  You know, they measure vibrations...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah, vibrations in the ground.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Yeah, well, I'm getting what I refer to scientifically as "weird vibes."  every sensor I've got is giving me strange readings.  I mean, the school has had these machines up here three years and they've never recorded anything like this.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Darn it!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Yeah.  But I'll tell you, if you ever wanted proof God is a man, this is it.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Think it's still following us?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Let's assume that it is.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah.  One, two, three...

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Rhonda's got an idea about that.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Yes, see, they move very easily through the Pleistocene Alluvials...  ...the dirt...the loose soil that makes up the valley floor.  But they can't move through solid rock. I think we should travel west to the mountains.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: You paying attention?  This oughta hurt like hell.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: It does.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: What's it doing?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Why do you all keep asking me?

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Yeah, they're confused.  They can feel our vibrations, but they can't find us.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: They're working together, too.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: What?!!  Since when the hell's every goddamn thing up to us?!

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: You guys do all the odd jobs.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Look, the situation hasn't changed. We still have to get to solid rock. There must be <u>some</u> way!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Like <u>what</u>?!  There's nothing left that'll make it to the mountains!

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Listen, they only respond to vibration, right?  Couldn't we... distract them somehow?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Yeah, good!  Something to keep them busy.  We need a decoy.

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: I think the ground's getting closer.  I think we do it.  We're gonna save our asses here!

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: Wait!  How are you going to know they're all following it?

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: Good point.

turns.speaker: RHONDA
turns.text: It worked!  There they go!

turns.speaker: VAL
turns.text: LET'S DO IT!

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: I brought it... to the coroner.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: An hour after you picked it up!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: From Chinatown... Which is right up the street from the morgue! Where did you go with the body? What did you do with it?

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: Please... I need to sleep...

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: You're fishing. You don't know shit.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I know about Esparza.

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: ...we had to lick his boots clean.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: He was your snitch.

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: Our own Colombian Connection... For three years... Three years of ball breaking detective work. And we put a lotta bad guys behind bars.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And one good guy.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Demerol? What the fuck is your problem, man? You wanna die?

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: I'm dead. We're both dead.

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: ...Where're we goin'?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That-a-boy. Hospital.

turns.speaker: BADALATO
turns.text: I don' need a hospital... I feel fine.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Too fine, Badalato. The bad news is, you're gonna live.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The photo on the left shows the bullet that killed Jimmy Chin, true?

turns.speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And the one on the right is the bullet you test-fired from Shu's gun?

turns.speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
turns.text: Correct.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You would have the court believe that these two bullets were fired from the same gun?

turns.speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Or this -- is this a significant difference?

turns.speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
turns.text: No it is not, Mr. Dowd.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Forensic ballistics isn't an exact science, is it?

turns.speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
turns.text: It most certainly is.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Isn't there a ten to fifteen-percent margin of error?

turns.speaker: BALLISTICS EXPERT
turns.text: Absolutely not. No more than seven percent.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: In other words, seven times out of a hundred, you're wrong!

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: Ms. Vin's sister.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I have to talk to your brother.

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: The hell you do. At this hour?

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: Gimme back my bottle.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Let go of my hair.

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: Don't hurt him.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Where's the nearest hospital?

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: Bellevue. Straight up First --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Objection, your Honor! The fact that the witness is currently a patient is immaterial!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Sustained.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: I will allow the witness to testify. With the understanding that your questions are confined to the area of Mr. Kim's modus operandi.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- With objection!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: So noted.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Your Honor, that's not fair -- !

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Complain to the Bar Commission.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Objection.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Sustained.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I move that the witness's testimony be stricken. He has clearly been terrorized by the prosecution, he's --

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: The testimony will remain in the record. Do you wish to cross-examine?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Dowd. Do you think you might be up to cross-examining Mr. Ortega this morning?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Your Honor: I imagine that, no matter how careful my questioning, Mr. Ortega would, in his well-intentioned way, dig my client's hole even deeper.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Well then, does the defense have any witnesses?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I suppose I could find an inmate who'd say that Shu boasted about Chinatown just to survive in the joint -- though he didn't really do it...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: -- Then you don't wish to call any witnesses, Mr. Dowd?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I would like to put Shu's alleged crime in a context, your Honor. And we do have the foremost expert on prison and street gangs right here in this room... If it please the court, I'd like to call Mr. Reynard.

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: You can't come back here... Anything happens to you I'm liable.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm a lawyer. The firm is thinking about renovating. Everything dates back to the Sixties.

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: I noticed.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Do you see a toilet here you think is really me?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Look, I'm a lawyer and --

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: -- I don't care who you are. You could've been killed. Every man and woman in here has done hard prison time. And we look out for each other.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: "We"?

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: I did five years in Attica. Lot of cons helped me in the joint. But I never got help from any lawyer... I built this business for guys like me who couldn't get a break anywhere else. "Art's Supplies" is for ex- cons. Not lawyers.

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: "Art's Supplies" is founded on trust, Mister --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Dowd. Eddie Dowd.

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: If you'd had the sense to ask for my help, I might've helped you. But you've probably scared Chuckie Roeder off for good, I have a whole bunch of jumpy employees to handle and you're both going to be on your way. Now.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What, "everything"? You shot a corpse. I don't give a shit about that -- !

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: Let's snuff this lowlife!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey -- the fact you popped Jimmy Chin in broad daylight proves it wasn't premeditated. Jury'll sympathize -- dude was banging your wife, right?

turns.speaker: ESPARZA
turns.text: Shut your sewer mouth!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Clyde, you wait here.  Glenn, got a minute?

turns.speaker: FULTON
turns.text: I had a minute before the Mapp hearing -- but I couldn't get you on the phone, Eddie...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah, well I had reasonable cause to believe the judge might've heard of the Fourth Amendment.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No it's not the only issue. There's another issue, for the jury. What about entrapment?

turns.speaker: FULTON
turns.text: What about entrapment?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We don't prosecute people because in the abstract they might be weak. Judge Brandeis said it best: Entrapment is a "dirty business!"

turns.speaker: FULTON
turns.text: Can't I take a simple piss without --

turns.speaker: FULTON
turns.text: Haven't heard that one before, Ed.  But I guess I'll be hearing it again.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Not necessarily...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Come now. Did you see the gun?

turns.speaker: MS. GORDON
turns.text: I can describe it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Oh really?

turns.speaker: MS. GORDON
turns.text: It was silver, with a stubby barrel... snub-nosed, I think they call it... It wasn't automatic, it had one of those... cylinders...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You can't remember that -- !

turns.speaker: MS. GORDON
turns.text: I can see the hammer still, it was cocked...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How can you remember that?

turns.speaker: MS. GORDON
turns.text: I didn't take my eyes off it!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: MS. GORDON
turns.text: Not the whole time, of course. I --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No further questions.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Exactly what information led you to arrest my client just two-and-a-half hours after the shooting took place?

turns.speaker: SKLAROFF
turns.text: We had a description of the suspect.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A "description"? What, Asian male 18 to 30, black hair, brown eyes?

turns.speaker: SKLAROFF
turns.text: We had information bearing on Mr. Kim's desire to gain admission into the Joe Boys by assassinating a member of a rival gang.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Didn't this "information" come from the Joe Boys themselves -- did they not all but hand you Shu Kai Kim, a Korean, an outsider?

turns.speaker: SKLAROFF
turns.text: You're implying that I planted a gun?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Not at all --

turns.speaker: SKLAROFF
turns.text: Kim's prints were all over it -- He admitted it was his gun, f'r godsake!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Your Honor, the witness' response was non-responsive... I ask you to strike it from the record...!

turns.speaker: SKLAROFF
turns.text: You see that? You wanna be like that?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No. No...

turns.speaker: SKLAROFF
turns.text: You fucking swear to shut up!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We have a full caseload, Rog.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Right, I forgot... We're pledged to protect every mid-level drug dealer in the Tri-state area.  It's an awesome responsibility.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't venerate drug dealers, Roger. To the contrary.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: ...through use of informants, eavesdropping, unreasonable search and seizure...!

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Right. You're right.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Damn right I'm right.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: It's just... I leave behind friends, family, a coupla good job offers in Chicago and in three dizzying weeks I've helped acquit a coke dealer, a speed dealer --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I specialize, Roger...

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- an angel dust dealer --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm not a kid anymore, I can't be all over the map --

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- a speed manufacturer --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So go take your job on Wall Street.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Don't tell me where to work. I moved to New York to work for Edward Dowd. But I can't believe that Edward Dowd has nothing better to do these days than invoke exalted legal issues to get off guilty little --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey. You plan to be a criminal defense attorney, know this going in: Everybody's guilty.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Ten years is a long time.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Look -- I'm tired, I'll see you in the morning, Eddie.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Ossining Correctional Facility. Sing Sing. Everybody's innocent there, man... Just ask 'em...

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Kim got busted at 19 for burglary. At 20 he was convicted in the shooting death of a young Chinese gang lord... The prosecution claimed Kim did it to get into "the Joe Boys"?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Chinatown street gang.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Kim denied it. But he admitted the gun was his, and he got life. Seems to have been an okay prisoner for eight years, til the... incident with Duane Lindeman.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- The Nazi he knifed?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: At the trial, you said you were at your apartment that night. Alone.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- Remember?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: ...So what would we claim? He stabbed Duane Lindeman in self-defense?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: With two knives taped to his hands? Forget it, Rog.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I feel like I've been mugged... Guy scared the shit out of me. You made your point, Eddie... I'm relieved we're not taking the case.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We're taking the other case.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: What other case?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Eight years ago. The Chinatown hit.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Some gang punk gets wasted in front of the tourists. The mayor pressures the cops. The cops pressure the rival gang -- the Joe Boys. The Joes give up Shu Kai Kim -- the schmuck kid from Korea who's been pestering 'em to get in.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: You really think that's what happened?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't know but it makes one hell of an opening statement.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Easy as that, huh?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Easy? No... We have to find some piece of evidence that got buried, to reopen the sucker.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: ...Are you sure we want that?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: When did you start working for the goddam D.A.?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Eddie... I don't know about this...

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Eddie... What's a DD-5?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A Complaint Follow-Up form.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Listen: "November 5, 1980. Cecil Stipe walked into 5th Precinct. Says he witnessed Chin shooting, saw suspect's picture in Post. Says Shu Kai Kim wrong man."

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: "Cecil Stipe"? Have we seen any affadavit with that name?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That DD-5.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: What, the lunatic who --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: "Cecil Stipe." Find it.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Do you have to do that?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: "Have to"? No...

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Shoulda told the one about Shu being the bastard child of Mother Theresa.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Saving it for the Sunday Times.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: His name is Chuckie Roeder. But something's very weird.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- You found his mugshot?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: They're just frightened, fucked-up losers that prison fucked up worse.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I didn't ask for a closing argument.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: There's no one else to talk to. The tattoos were phony!

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Yeah?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So an upstanding member of the Aryan Warriors wouldn't paint them on. They take those teardrops seriously -- they're badges of courage, of honor. Only their most vicious killer elite get to wear them...!

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I feel much better now.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey, Clyde Gruner sold these guys a pound of crystal meth at cost. We're Clyde's buddies, it's cool.  Next exit.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Uh, Eddie? The, um, ballistics guy, George...? He called, and...  His tests show that Shu's gun fired the bullet that killed Jimmy Chin.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: George is a fucking burnout case. I didn't want him on the stand anyway. Get more names from Billy.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A fucking wheelchair?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: A spinal injury, in the line of duty. It was in Kitty's report...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Eddie Dowd.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Roger Baron.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Goddam it... the little punk bests me again, I get thrown down and lectured at and where the hell were you?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: 1530 Rivington Street.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- What?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Chuckie's address. I sneaked a peek at the Rolodex.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You sneaked a peek at the Rolodex.  Nice.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: So what're we gonna do?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: ...What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Well, I mean, Roeder's gone, now... A dead end. Believe me, I'm sorry too, but...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: But what?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I've heard from the last ballistics expert on the list. It's an even ten who say Shu's gun killed Jimmy Chin!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's why I hate experts.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Eddie... it's one thing to compare Clyde Gruner to Jesus Christ. It's even okay to claim that Shu Kai Kim is just slightly holier than the Pope... as long as you don't really believe it!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey -- you believe what you want. Shu Kai Kim is innocent.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- Eddie...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You know how I know? 'Cause Reynard says he's guilty, and Reynard's full of shit! Look --

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: You're carrying that around like it was a picture of your girlfriend!  I don't want to see your heart broken when this case crashes and burns!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's not gonna happen. I'm gonna create reasonable doubt. Buckle your seatbelt and watch me work.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: But Roeder's dead. Ballistics says it's Shu! We don't have one witness -- unless we put Cecil Stipe on the stand...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm not that desperate.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I am. Eddie -- we've got nothing.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I've got a meeting in Chinatown.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Let's get a cab.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- Roger -- ?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Eddie -- it's Art Esparza!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What's Art Esparza?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I think he hired Shu to kill Jimmy Chin... It wasn't a Chinatown gang hit -- Jimmy Chin and Art's wife were lovers! She just about told me...!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You phoned up Art Esparza's wife?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: I followed her from the courthouse.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: -- What?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I've seen this picture before.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: They could've been brothers. It's why the eyewitnesses picked Shu.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Christ... Shu is innocent.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: "The killer wasn't Chinese"... Cecil Stipe was right. .!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Everyone else was wrong and the one fucking lunatic was right!

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: ...Jesus!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Least we'd already be at the Morgue.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How long did it take Badalato to drive Jimmy Chin's body from Chinatown to the morgue?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: ... An hour.  That's why I thought the morgue was on the other side of town.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're the police expert in Chinatown gangs?

turns.speaker: GANG EXPERT
turns.text: ...For ten years, now.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Do you speak Cantonese, Mandarin, or both?

turns.speaker: GANG EXPERT
turns.text: -- Me? Neither.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Pardon... Which dialect do you speak?

turns.speaker: GANG EXPERT
turns.text: Neither.

turns.speaker: GANG EXPERT
turns.text: They're Chinamen who speak English. We call them informants.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And I call your testimony hearsay. I have no more questions for you.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Murder witness.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: You're doing a murder case?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It hasn't been that long.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Stipe was just one of four eyewitnesses who came forward, Kitty. Y'oughta start looking for the others...

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Eddie, I'm not working on this case. You boys have fun.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Lemme guess. Some corporate V.P.'s banging his secretary over lunch and you have to focus your camera and plug in your little tape recorder.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Beats getting paid in twenties by slimedogs selling angel dust to high school seniors.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Kitty, where exactly do you place the microphone to catch the most incriminating moans?

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: Just which Constitutional amendment protects our right to peddle PCP?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Forget it. You've blown your chance to participate in this case, Kitty.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I'm kicking myself, Eddie... Right out of here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Start looking into the Joe Boys -- who assigned the hits in 1980, what rank generally did the hits...  Your extensive law enforcement contacts should be of some use.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I was never politically correct enough for Comrade Dowd.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I embellished.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: "Dowd also reports that his team of private investigators..."?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I embroidered.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: "...are close to naming the man they believe actually killed Jimmy Chin"?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I lied.

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: So there goes your theory about the Joes giving up Shu to protect their trigger man.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: But I like that theory. And since I'm not putting Twerp Professor on the stand, and since I don't have a better theory, I'm sticking with that theory. Meantime I want pictures of the Joes. What'll you bet there was a guy in the gang looked enough like Shu to fool the eyewitnesses!

turns.speaker: KITTY
turns.text: I've phoned every art supply retailer and wholesaler in the Tri-state area. No one's heard of Chuckie Roeder.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Have you considered that Chuckie Roeder's not calling himself Chuckie Roeder these days? Get his mugshot from one of the many law officers who've got hotpants for you... then canvass those art supplies places. We're gonna win this one, Kitty, but ya gotta believe...
